## type alias_ConfigValidator
> **ConfigValidator**\<`T`\>: `{ [K in keyof T]?: WritableWithDefaultOptions<T[K]> }`

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

## type alias_Directive
> **Directive**\<`T`, `U`\>: (`node`, `args`) => `void` \| `object`

### Type Parameters

• **T** = `void`

• **U** *extends* [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement) = [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement)

### Parameters

• **node**: `U`

• **args**: `T`

### Returns

`void` \| `object`

## type alias_DirectivesAndOptParam
> **DirectivesAndOptParam**\<`T`, `U`\>: \{ \[K in keyof T\]: Directive\<void, U\> \| DirectiveAndParam\<T\[K\], U\> \}

• **U** *extends* [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement) = [`SSRHTMLElement`](#ssrhtmlelement)

## type alias_NormalizeValue
> **NormalizeValue**\<`T`\>: (`value`) => `T` \| *typeof* [`INVALID_VALUE`](#invalid_value)

### Type Parameters

• **T**

### Parameters

• **value**: `T`

### Returns

`T` \| *typeof* [`INVALID_VALUE`](#invalid_value)

## interface_PropsConfig
### Type Parameters

• **U** *extends* `object`

### Properties

#### config?

> `optional` **config**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`U`\>\> \| [`ValuesOrReadableSignals`](#valuesorreadablesignals)\<[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`U`\>\>

Either a store of objects containing, for each property, the default value,
or an object containing, for each property, either a store containing the default value or the default value itself.

***

#### props?

> `optional` **props**: [`ValuesOrWritableSignals`](#valuesorwritablesignals)\<`U`\>

Object containing, for each property, either its initial value, or a store that will contain the value at any time.
When the value of a property is undefined or invalid, the value from the config is used.

## type alias_SlotsPresent
> **SlotsPresent**\<`Props`\>: \{ \[K in keyof Props as IsSlotContent\<Props\[K\]\> extends SlotContent\<any\> ? K extends "children" ? "default" : K extends \`slot$\{infer U\}\` ? Uncapitalize\<U\> : K : never\]?: boolean \}

### Type Parameters

• **Props** *extends* `object`

## interface_SSRHTMLElement
Subset of HTMLElement that is available in a server side rendering context.

### Properties

#### classList

> **classList**: [`Pick`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#picktype-keys)\<[`DOMTokenList`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/DOMTokenList), `"remove"` \| `"add"` \| `"toggle"`\>

Object allowing to manipulate the classes of the element.

***

#### style

> **style**: [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<[`Record`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#recordkeys-type)\<[`StyleKey`](#stylekey), [`StyleValue`](#stylevalue)\>\>

Object allowing to manipulate the style of the element.

### Methods

#### removeAttribute

> **removeAttribute**(`qualifiedName`): `void`

Removes element's first attribute whose qualified name is qualifiedName.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/removeAttribute)

##### Parameters

• **qualifiedName**: `string`

##### Returns

`void`

***

#### setAttribute

> **setAttribute**(`qualifiedName`, `value`): `void`

Sets the value of element's first attribute whose qualified name is qualifiedName to value.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/setAttribute)

##### Parameters

• **qualifiedName**: `string`

• **value**: `string`

##### Returns

`void`

## function_toSlotContextWidget
> **toSlotContextWidget**\<`W`\>(`w`): [`ContextWidget`](#contextwidget)\<`W`\>

Extract actions, api, directives, state and stores from the widget to be passed to slots as context.

### Type Parameters

• **W** *extends* [`Widget`](#widget)\<`object`, `object`, `object`, `object`, `object`\>

### Parameters

• **w**: `W`

the widget

### Returns

[`ContextWidget`](#contextwidget)\<`W`\>

the slot context

## type alias_ValuesOrReadableSignals
> **ValuesOrReadableSignals**\<`T`\>: \{ \[K in keyof T\]?: ReadableSignal\<T\[K\] \| undefined\> \| T\[K\] \}

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

## type alias_ValuesOrWritableSignals
> **ValuesOrWritableSignals**\<`T`\>: \{ \[K in keyof T\]?: WritableSignal\<T\[K\] \| undefined\> \| T\[K\] \}

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

## interface_Widget
### Type Parameters

• **Props** *extends* `object` = `object`

• **State** *extends* `object` = `object`

• **Api** *extends* `object` = `object`

• **Actions** *extends* `object` = `object`

• **Directives** *extends* `object` = `object`

### Properties

#### actions

> **actions**: `Actions`

all the handlers that should be connected to user interactions i.e. click, keyboard and touch interactions.
typically, the handlers are event listeners that call api functions to affect the widget state

***

#### api

> **api**: `Api`

all the api functions to interact with the widget

***

#### directives

> **directives**: `Directives`

directives to be used on html elements in the template of the widget or in the slots

***

#### state$

> **state$**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`State`\>

the reactive state of the widget, combining all the values served by the stores

***

#### stores

> **stores**: \{ \[K in string \| number \| symbol as \`$\{K & string\}$\`\]: ReadableSignal\<State\[K\]\> \}

the different stores of the widget, all reactive

### Methods

#### patch

> **patch**(`parameters`): `void`

Modify the parameter values, and recalculate the stores accordingly

##### Parameters

• **parameters**: [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`Props`\>

##### Returns

`void`

## type alias_WidgetFactory
> **WidgetFactory**\<`W`\>: (`props`?) => `W`

### Type Parameters

• **W** *extends* [`Widget`](#widget)

### Parameters

• **props?**: [`PropsConfig`](#propsconfig)\<[`WidgetProps`](#widgetprops)\<`W`\>\>

### Returns

`W`

## type alias_WidgetPropsSlots
> **WidgetPropsSlots**\<`Props`\>: \{ \[K in keyof Props as IsSlotContent\<Props\[K\]\> extends SlotContent\<any\> ? K extends "children" ? "default" : K extends \`slot$\{infer U\}\` ? Uncapitalize\<U\> : K : never\]: Props\[K\] extends SlotContent\<infer U\> ? U : never \}

### Type Parameters

• **Props** *extends* `object`

## interface_WidgetSlotContext
### Type Parameters

• **W** *extends* [`Widget`](#widget)

### Properties

#### state

> **state**: [`WidgetState`](#widgetstate)\<`W`\>

the state of the widget

***

#### widget

> **widget**: [`ContextWidget`](#contextwidget)\<`W`\>

the widget

## interface_WritableWithDefaultOptions
### Type Parameters

• **T**

### Properties

#### equal()?

> `optional` **equal**: (`a`, `b`) => `boolean`

the equal function, allowing to compare two values. used to check if a previous and current values are equals.

##### Parameters

• **a**: `T`

• **b**: `T`

##### Returns

`boolean`

***

#### normalizeValue?

> `optional` **normalizeValue**: [`NormalizeValue`](#normalizevalue)\<`T`\>

the normalize value function. should return the invalidValue symbol when the provided value is invalid
